intro: Norantea berteroi, commonly known as the Canary Islands rockrose, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its compact, shrub-like growth habit. The plant features small, pink or white flowers that bloom in spring, often clustered at the ends of its stems. Its leaves are typically narrow and covered in fine hairs, adapted to the arid conditions of its native habitat. Norantea berteroi is well-suited to rocky soils and is often found growing in coastal and mountainous regions.
